module.exports = {
	"private": true,
	"name": "dnh-cpp",
	"homepage": "https://cpp.daynhauhoc.com",
	"scripts": {
		"lint:js": "eslint --fix .",
		"lint:css": "stylelint \"web_modules/**/*.css\"",
		"lint": "npm run lint:js && npm run lint:css",
		"start": "phenomic start",
		"prebuild": "npm run lint && npm run fetch",
		"build": "phenomic build",
		"test": "jest",
		"fetch": "rm -rf content/generated && babel-node scripts/content/fetch-data.js",
		"deploy": "gh-pages --silent --repo https://$GITHUB_TOKEN@github.com/thangngoc89/dnh-cpp.git --dist dist",
		"predeploy:cron": "babel cron/src/handler.js --out-file cron/handler.js",
		"deploy:cron": "cd cron && serverless deploy"
	},
	"jest": {
		"automock": false
	},
	"phenomic": {
		"CNAME": true,
		"offline": true,
		"assets": false,
		"devPort": 5353
	},
	"eslintConfig": {
		"parser": "babel-eslint",
		"env": {
			"browser": true,
			"jest": true,
			"node": true
		},
		"extends": [
			"eslint-config-i-am-meticulous/react"
		],
		"rules": {
			"react/prefer-stateless-function": 0,
			"react/jsx-no-literals": 0,
			"max-len": 0
		}
	},
	"eslintConfigRuleReact/prefer-stateless-function": "https://github.com/MoOx/phenomic/issues/46",
	"stylelint": {
		"extends": "stylelint-config-standard"
	},
	"devDependencies": {
		"babel-cli": "^6.3.17",
		"babel-core": "^6.3.26",
		"babel-eslint": "^6.0.0-beta.0",
		"babel-loader": "^6.2.0",

		"babel-preset-react": "^6.3.13",
		"babel-preset-react-hmre": "^1.0.1",
		"babel-preset-stage-1": "^6.3.13",
		"css-loader": "^0.23.0",
		"cssnano": "^3.5.2",
		"eslint": "^2.0.0",
		"eslint-config-i-am-meticulous": "^4.1.1",
		"eslint-loader": "^1.3.0",
		"eslint-plugin-react": "^4.3.0",
		"extract-text-webpack-plugin": "^1.0.1",
		"file-loader": "^0.8.1",
		"fs-extra": "^0.30.0",
		"github-markdown-css": "^2.2.1",
		"highlight.js": "^9.3.0",
		"hint.css": "^2.2.1",
		"history": "^2.0.0",
		"invariant": "^2.1.1",
		"jest-cli": "^14.1.0",
		"json-loader": "^0.5.2",
		"phenomic": "^0.17.4",
		"postcss-browser-reporter": "^0.4.0",
		"postcss-cssnext": "^2.4.0",
		"postcss-loader": "^0.7.0",
		"postcss-reporter": "^1.3.0",
		"raw-loader": "^0.5.1",
		"react": "^15.0.0",
		"react-custom-scrollbars": "^4.0.0",
		"react-dom": "^15.0.0",
		"react-helmet": "^3.0.0",
		"react-redux": "^4.0.0",
		"react-router": "^2.2.2",
		"react-svg-inline": "^1.1.0",
		"react-topbar-progress-indicator": "^1.0.0",
		"redux": "^3.0.0",
		"rehype": "^2.0.0",
		"rehype-highlight": "^1.0.0",
		"stats-webpack-plugin": "^0.4.2",
		"style-loader": "^0.12.3",

};

 * returning `false`.

 * @param {Function} iteratee The function invoked per iteration.
 * @param {Function} keysFunc The function to get the keys of `object`.
 * @returns {Object} Returns `object`.
 */
var baseFor = createBaseFor();

module.exports = baseFor;

/**

 * of patent rights can be found in the PATENTS file in the same directory.

'use strict';

var camelize = require('./camelize');

var msPattern = /^-ms-/;

/**
 * Camelcases a hyphenated CSS property name, for example:
 *
 *   > camelizeStyleName('background-color')
 *   < "backgroundColor"
 *   > camelizeStyleName('-moz-transition')
 *   < "MozTransition"
 *   > camelizeStyleName('-ms-transition')
 *   < "msTransition"
 *
 * As Andi Smith suggests
 * (http://www.andismith.com/blog/2012/02/modernizr-prefixed/), an `-ms` prefix
 * is converted to lowercase `ms`.
 *
 * @param {string} string
 * @return {string}
 */
function camelizeStyleName(string) {
  return camelize(string.replace(msPattern, 'ms-'));
}

module.exports = camelizeStyleName;

var arrayMap = require('../internal/arrayMap'),
    baseCallback = require('../internal/baseCallback'),
    baseMap = require('../internal/baseMap'),
    isArray = require('../lang/isArray');

/**
 * Creates an array of values by running each element in `collection` through
 * `iteratee`. The `iteratee` is bound to `thisArg` and invoked with three
 * arguments: (value, index|key, collection).
 *
 * If a property name is provided for `iteratee` the created `_.property`
 * style callback returns the property value of the given element.
 *
 * If a value is also provided for `thisArg` the created `_.matchesProperty`
 * style callback returns `true` for elements that have a matching property
 * value, else `false`.
 *
 * If an object is provided for `iteratee` the created `_.matches` style
 * callback returns `true` for elements that have the properties of the given
 * object, else `false`.
 *
 * Many lodash methods are guarded to work as iteratees for methods like
 * `_.every`, `_.filter`, `_.map`, `_.mapValues`, `_.reject`, and `_.some`.
 *
 * The guarded methods are:
 * `ary`, `callback`, `chunk`, `clone`, `create`, `curry`, `curryRight`,
 * `drop`, `dropRight`, `every`, `fill`, `flatten`, `invert`, `max`, `min`,
 * `parseInt`, `slice`, `sortBy`, `take`, `takeRight`, `template`, `trim`,
 * `trimLeft`, `trimRight`, `trunc`, `random`, `range`, `sample`, `some`,
 * `sum`, `uniq`, and `words`
 *
 * @static
 * @memberOf _
 * @alias collect
 * @category Collection
 * @param {Array|Object|string} collection The collection to iterate over.
 * @param {Function|Object|string} [iteratee=_.identity] The function invoked
 *  per iteration.
 * @param {*} [thisArg] The `this` binding of `iteratee`.
 * @returns {Array} Returns the new mapped array.
 * @example
 *
 * function timesThree(n) {
 *   return n * 3;
 * }
 *
 * _.map([1, 2], timesThree);
 * // => [3, 6]
 *
 * _.map({ 'a': 1, 'b': 2 }, timesThree);
 * // => [3, 6] (iteration order is not guaranteed)
 *
 * var users = [
 *   { 'user': 'barney' },
 *   { 'user': 'fred' }
 * ];
 *
 * // using the `_.property` callback shorthand
 * _.map(users, 'user');
 * // => ['barney', 'fred']
 */
function map(collection, iteratee, thisArg) {
  var func = isArray(collection) ? arrayMap : baseMap;
  iteratee = baseCallback(iteratee, thisArg, 3);
  return func(collection, iteratee);
}

module.exports = map;

'use strict';

var camelize = require('./camelize');

var msPattern = /^-ms-/;

/**
 * Camelcases a hyphenated CSS property name, for example:
 *
 *   > camelizeStyleName('background-color')
 *   < "backgroundColor"
 *   > camelizeStyleName('-moz-transition')
 *   < "MozTransition"
 *   > camelizeStyleName('-ms-transition')
 *   < "msTransition"
 *
 * As Andi Smith suggests
 * (http://www.andismith.com/blog/2012/02/modernizr-prefixed/), an `-ms` prefix
 * is converted to lowercase `ms`.
 *
 * @param {string} string
 * @return {string}
 */
function camelizeStyleName(string) {
  return camelize(string.replace(msPattern, 'ms-'));
}

module.exports = camelizeStyleName;

    baseCallback = require('../internal/baseCallback'),
    baseMap = require('../internal/baseMap'),
    isArray = require('../lang/isArray');

/**
 * Creates an array of values by running each element in `collection` through
 * `iteratee`. The `iteratee` is bound to `thisArg` and invoked with three
 * arguments: (value, index|key, collection).
 *
 * If a property name is provided for `iteratee` the created `_.property`
 * style callback returns the property value of the given element.
 *
 * If a value is also provided for `thisArg` the created `_.matchesProperty`
 * style callback returns `true` for elements that have a matching property
 * value, else `false`.
 *
 * If an object is provided for `iteratee` the created `_.matches` style
 * callback returns `true` for elements that have the properties of the given
 * object, else `false`.
 *
 * Many lodash methods are guarded to work as iteratees for methods like
 * `_.every`, `_.filter`, `_.map`, `_.mapValues`, `_.reject`, and `_.some`.
 *
 * The guarded methods are:
 * `ary`, `callback`, `chunk`, `clone`, `create`, `curry`, `curryRight`,
 * `drop`, `dropRight`, `every`, `fill`, `flatten`, `invert`, `max`, `min`,
 * `parseInt`, `slice`, `sortBy`, `take`, `takeRight`, `template`, `trim`,
 * `trimLeft`, `trimRight`, `trunc`, `random`, `range`, `sample`, `some`,
 * `sum`, `uniq`, and `words`
 *
 * @static
 * @memberOf _
 * @alias collect
 * @category Collection
 * @param {Array|Object|string} collection The collection to iterate over.
 * @param {Function|Object|string} [iteratee=_.identity] The function invoked
 *  per iteration.
 * @param {*} [thisArg] The `this` binding of `iteratee`.
 * @returns {Array} Returns the new mapped array.
 * @example
 *
 * function timesThree(n) {
 *   return n * 3;
 * }
 *
 * _.map([1, 2], timesThree);
 * // => [3, 6]
 *
 * _.map({ 'a': 1, 'b': 2 }, timesThree);
 * // => [3, 6] (iteration order is not guaranteed)
 *
 * var users = [
 *   { 'user': 'barney' },
 *   { 'user': 'fred' }
 * ];
 *
 * // using the `_.property` callback shorthand
 * _.map(users, 'user');
 * // => ['barney', 'fred']
 */

  return func(collection, iteratee);
}
